item.title: 艺术让人成为人
item.description:
This paper applies single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to dissect cellular heterogeneity in mouse models of Alzheimer’s disease.

Key points:

  • Dataset: scRNA-seq from hippocampus region at different stages of disease progression.
  • Findings:
  • Identification of 5 major microglia subtypes.
  • Disease-associated microglia (DAM) emerge early and expand with time.
  • Conclusion: Dynamic microglia states correlate with amyloid burden and neuroinflammation.

This study underscores the potential of single-cell technologies to uncover immune dynamics in neurodegenerative disorders.

item.title: Single-cell transcriptomics in Alzheimer's Disease
item.description:
This paper applies single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to dissect cellular heterogeneity in mouse models of Alzheimer’s disease.

Key points:

  • Dataset: scRNA-seq from hippocampus region at different stages of disease progression.
  • Findings:
    • Identification of 5 major microglia subtypes.
    • Disease-associated microglia (DAM) emerge early and expand with time.

This study underscores the potential of single-cell technologies to uncover immune dynamics in neurodegenerative disorders.

item.title: About
item.description:
Tyanxu, currently studying at Sun Yat-sen University, is a PhD of toxicology who doesn't do his job properly. Compared with his professional study, his performance in graphic design makes him more proud, so he is also a wild graphic designer and an explorer who loves reading and technology.

Here, it records inspirational moments in life, share bits and pieces of reading, designing, and development, while also retaining some of gazes and reflections on the world.
